column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There was a similar number of 153 trade and export cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with quality of trade cattle not as good. Prices lost the gains of last week with many averages 10c to 15c/kg cheaper.
Yearling steers made 214c to 248c and leaner 170c to 190c while the best heifers made 180c to 208c/kg.
The few grown steers and bullocks made 208c to 240c.

There were 70 cows and most were cheaper with the best heavy cows making 160c to 184c, leaner 120c to 152c and very lean 58c to 90c/kg.
 Heavy bulls sold for 120c to 150c/kg liveweight.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
